fields.description:
A very wide table added to a comment will get truncated to fit the screen, making it impossible to see the last columns. Columns can be seen if, for example, you have a dual-screen setup and can spread the window across both screens.

A scrollbar would be nice.
fields.summary: Wide tables truncated in comments

fields.description:
At the moment small and medium resize icons link are thumbnails for the the image. This is inconstant with the "large" resize icon. This request is to make the large resize icon the same. It should:

# Display the image in a large thumbnail size
# Link to the original size of the image.
fields.summary: Make "large" in the image editor propery panel a thumbnail to the full-sized image

fields.description:
The background color of the space details form is not consistent - it has both gray and white.
See attached
fields.summary: Edit space details background is not consistant

fields.description: Add support to confluence for the new WebPanel plugin module.
fields.summary: WebPanel support for Confluence

fields.description:
If you are presented with a web CAPTCHA, then the tab ordering is busted.  It tabs to the image which is annoying and I would argue it should not tab to the refresh icon thingy

I think it should be name / password / captcha field
fields.summary: The new CAPTCHA tab order is broken.

fields.description:
If you click on an image in the RTE and then click the Image dialog button on the toolbar, it doesn't let you edit the image you clicked.

You can edit a link with the Link dialog; you should be able to edit an image.
fields.summary: In Rich Text editor can't edit image in the Image Dialog

fields.description: Dashboard is fine, however using the recently updated macro on a page gives "Recently Updated" rather than the German equivalent.
fields.summary: Recently updated macro not in German

fields.description:
Ancestor table can get corrupted (sometimes Page.getAncestors() can return duplicates).

This can cause issues when WebDAV's strict path checking functionality is enabled ([WBDV-204|https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/WBDV-204]), rendering the Office Connector plugin useless as a result: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/The+Internet+Address+Is+Not+Valid+Error+Message+due+to+Corrupt+Ancestor+Table.

We are still investigating this issue and are looking for sample backup to allow us hasten the fix.

If you are willing to participate, please let us know: http://support.atlassian.com (an anonymized backup should suffice).
fields.summary: Page.getAncestors() can sometime return duplicates

fields.description:
assertLinkInserted method is needed for tests other than Link Browser tests.

Move it out of AbstractLinkBrowserTest and into ConfluenceSeleniumAssertions
fields.summary: Testability change required: Move Asserts for links out of AbstractLinkBrowserTest

fields.description:
I can reproduce the following in FF and Safari:
1. Open the edit page and make sure the window is high enough so you don't have a scroll bar
2. Click on an image to open the property panel

You will see some jerky behaviour on the right side of the screen.
fields.summary: Jerky editor when clicking on image with no scroll bar

fields.description: Templates that use the {{menuMacros_renderLeftNavMenu}} (such as admin and space admin screens) will have menu items with id "$item.link.id" generated. We should check that the web item has an id.
fields.summary: Remove $item.link.id ids generated on left menus

fields.description: Add the ability to view a page via a gadget
fields.summary: Confluence Page Gadget
Links property panel should populate the search tab in the links browser if its an internal link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19739].
  {panel}

It would be nice if the *Global Colour Scheme* (not *Theme Colour Scheme*) is selected as default *Space Colour Scheme* for the newly created spaces which use *Global Look and Feel* theme when the following themes are used as *Global*/*Site* theme:
* Documentation Theme
* Easy Reader Theme
* Clickr Theme

The desired behaviour is something like how the Default Theme and Left Navigation Theme behaves when it is selected as *Global*/*Site* theme; i.e. when the Global Colour Scheme is changed/customised, it should be used as a default colour scheme by the newly created spaces.

This can be easily understood by the following steps:
# Select Documentation Theme as the Global theme:
[^1.Global_Theme.png]
# Select Custom Colour Scheme as the Global Colour Scheme
[^2.Global_Colour_Scheme.png]
# Create a new space and choose *Global Look and Feel* as the space theme
[^3.Create_Space_Global_Look_Feel.png]
# The newly created space will look like this:
[^4.New_Space.png]
# If you notice at the Space Colour Scheme, the *Global Colour Scheme* is not selected as default colour scheme, but *Theme Colour Scheme*:
[^5.Space_Colour_Scheme.png]
fields.summary: Global Colour Scheme should be selected as default when new spaces are created

fields.description: The {{bootstrapPluginManager}} defined in the {{setupContext.xml}} file is still accessible from the plugins framework. This causes a problem with classes in the plugins framework that require injection of {{com.atlassian.plugin.PluginAccessor}} as the {{ConfluencePluginManager}} also implements this interface. This does not affect plugin autowiring as the {{bootstrapPluginManager}} is not exported as an OSGi service, only the plugins framework and possibly internal confluence classes that are autowired; however plugins using the default web-panel implementations will be broken. The new {{web-panel}} feature of plugins 2.5 has two default implementations {{EmbeddedTemplateWebPanel}} and {{ResourceTemplateWebPanel}} which both depend on constructor injection of a {{PluginAccessor}}. This means that the {{ConfluenceHostContainer}} will throw an exception when attempting to autowire one of these -> the following module descriptors are currently broken in confluence: {code:title=Static Web Panel Resource} Hello World!]]> {code} {code:title=Velocity Web Panel Resource} {code} \\ If your plugin implements it's own {{WebPanel}} and specifies it as below then it will work. {code:title=Web Panel Custom Class} {code} \\ We need to remove the {{bootstrapPluginManager}} from the spring context after it has finished being useful.
fields.summary: bootstrapPluginManager is still available to plugins system - is not thrown away.

fields.description:
There is a very popular feature request, CONF-6478, for "watch just the news (blog posts) in a space".  I would like something similar, to watch all the blog posts in the site. Not comments on them, just creation and editing (or maybe just creation).

What I want the most is just creation, but I think for consistency with other watches, edits should be included too. Also, if anybody ever finishes implementing restrictions on blog posts, then I would certainly want to see posts that go from restricted to unrestricted, which is an edit rather than a create, and really, edits to published blogs are pretty rare on the site I want it for.
fields.summary: News (blog) watching for full site

fields.description:
User belongs to a group with 'view' and 'create attachments' permissions only.

The user will be able to upload attachments to a page but not edit or remove them. However, if an embedded document exists on the page a user will be able to edit this in Office via the page UI regardless of permissions.
fields.summary: User can edit embedded office documents without create page permissions

fields.description: At the moment the only way to allow editing of a page or attachment is to allow a user to create pages. In some cases, an admin may want their users to be able to attach/edit documents or attachments but not to edit the actual page itself. Having 'edit' permissions separate from 'create' would allow this.
fields.summary: Seperate 'create' and 'edit' permissions for pages and attachments

fields.description:
In 3.0 the only way to get notifications of actions by people you are following is with the rss feed from the network tab.  I'd like to get email notifications from people I'm following instead.

I currently use watch page, watch space and the rss network feed. Currently my RSS feed for the network contains very similar data to the emails from the spaces I watch, so it would be great to have these unified by getting it all in email.
fields.summary: Receive email notifications for updates by followed users

fields.description:
In Confluence 3.2.1, it appears that the User Search function now optionally adds wildcarding BEFORE as well as after the specified search parameter. This occurs when the new Confluence Admin option "Append wildcards to user and group searches" is set to Yes. The User Search dialog works this way whether doing admistrative Manage Users or editing page restrictions. Yes is the default after upgrade.

For large LDAP systems this can cause unexpected searious delays. We're were seeing 3-minute response times with the 3.2.1 system and didn't understand the cause without Atlassian support involvement.

Request 1) Atlassian should document this functionality change  for 3.2.1 upgrades for Administrators, perhaps. Did I miss it in the documentation?

The prior implementation gave the user feedback by adding the wildcards to the specified parameter, so that the user can see the exact wildcarding implemented.

Request 2) Restore the feedback functionality.

The group search function, visible via the page restrictions edit dialog, apparently doesn't add a wildcard to the front of the specified parameter, even if the "Append wildcards to user and group searches" is set to Yes. Obviously the functionality and the option descriptor are inconsistent.

Request 3) Make the option accurately reflect the functionality. Preferably, I guess someone may want to have the Group Search function changed rather than the option descriptor.

Request 4) Bring back the old functinality. Add a new choice for the Back Only option.

Wildcarding = No
Wildcarding = Front and Back
Wildcarding = BACK ONLY LIKE CONFLUENCE USED TO DO IT

How hard would it have been to do that, and make the system backwards compatible?

Request 5) Think about implementing future changes allowing backwards compatibility

Thanks!
fields.summary: Group Search wildcarding inconsistent with User Search and with Append Wildcards option

# Download a Russian language pack from [this site|http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/173229/translation_russian_RU3.jar]

# Create a new user using Russian character with the username of (привет) which means 'hello'
# In Confluence search box, search for any strings/characters

If the user exist in Confluence, this error message will not be thrown.

Notification emails take a long time to display on slow links

fields.description: I normally middle-click and drag to scroll up and down through a page.  It is more efficient than having to move the mouse all the way to the right and drag the scroll bar.  For some reason, I cannot do this in Confluence, because middle-clicking appears to do nothing at all.
fields.summary: Can't middle-click and drag in Confluence

fields.description: I tested this file and figured out that the problem is with the customized template design. When I changed to another template design it worked well.
fields.summary: PPT customized template design is not working

fields.summary: NPE in ConfluenceEventManager on AttachmentRemoveEvent

fields.description:
If page title contains nonenglish symbols WebDav launcher sent incorrect URL to Application the result is - can't edit pages in word.
Page content stored in UTF-8. "Edit in word" works fine in Internet Explorer.
fields.summary: "edit in word" doen's work in firefox for non-english page titles - WebDav launcher does not support nonenglish symbols in URL

fields.description:
Currently our CSS specifies just 'monospace', which uses the browser's default monospace font. This usually isn't the nicest-looking monospace font available on the platform.

We should add some styles which use the monospace fonts used by the OS on each platform:

- On Windows, Consolas
- On Mac OS X, Monaco.

(Any recommendations on an appropriate Linux monospace font would be great! :))

The font size needs to be specified in px (rather than the current points) because in my testing these fonts appear to vary considerably in size when the same point size is specified. Pixels don't have the same problem.
fields.summary: Better monospace font for wiki textarea

fields.description:
After upgrading to 3.2.1, I started noticing the following exception in the log:

{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.PluginResourceLocatorImpl.locateBatchPluginResource(PluginResourceLocatorImpl.java:148)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.PluginResourceLocatorImpl.getDownloadableResource(PluginResourceLocatorImpl.java:85)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.PluginResourceDownload.serveFile(PluginResourceDownload.java:54)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.AbstractFileServerServlet.doGet(AbstractFileServerServlet.java:32)
        at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:796)
        at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:917)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.servletService(ApplicationFilterChain.java:398)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationDispatcher.invoke(ApplicationDispatcher.java:792)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationDispatcher.doForward(ApplicationDispatcher.java:472)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationDispatcher.forward(ApplicationDispatcher.java:353)
        at org.tuckey.web.filters.urlrewrite.RewrittenUrl.doRewrite(RewrittenUrl.java:176)
        at org.tuckey.web.filters.urlrewrite.UrlRewriteFilter.doFilter(UrlRewriteFilter.java:728)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:217)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:185)
        at com.atlassian.gzipfilter.GzipFilter.doFilterInternal(GzipFilter.java:75)
        at com.atlassian.gzipfilter.GzipFilter.doFilter(GzipFilter.java:51)
{noformat}

several different paths are affected, for example:
* /s/1636/4/1.0.2/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.auiplugin:jquery-base/com.atlassian.auiplugin:jquery-base.js
* /s/1636/4/1.0.2/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.auiplugin:dialog/com.atlassian.auiplugin:dialog.css
* /s/1636/4/1.0.2/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.auiplugin:drop-down/com.atlassian.auiplugin:drop-down.css

Upon further debugging I noticed that the requests where coming mostly from google webcache that points to assets on the live site. So it looks like the superbatch introduced in 3.2, replaced lots of individual assets that however are still being requested by clients with stale cache. This is mostly harmless, except that our production logs are being polluted with tons of error messages and stack traces that make it difficult to see other problems. This should be an easy, but valuable fix.

fields.description:
When using MySQL and working with pages with a large number of versions, indexing stalls at 99%.  The MySQL slow query log shows that queries like this are taking a very long time to run:

{code:sql}
select contentent0_.CONTENTID as CONTENTID, contentent0_.CONTENTTYPE as CONTENTT2_, contentent0_.TITLE as TITLE, contentent0_.VERSION as VERSION, contentent0_.CREATOR as CREATOR, contentent0_.CREATIONDATE as CREATION6_, contentent0_.LASTMODIFIER as LASTMODI7_, contentent0_.LASTMODDATE as LASTMODD8_, contentent0_.VERSIONCOMMENT as VERSIONC9_, contentent0_.PREVVER as PREVVER, contentent0_.CONTENT_STATUS as CONTENT11_, contentent0_.SPACEID as SPACEID, contentent0_.CHILD_POSITION as CHILD_P13_, contentent0_.PARENTID as PARENTID, contentent0_.MESSAGEID as MESSAGEID, contentent0_.DRAFTPAGEID as DRAFTPA16_, contentent0_.DRAFTSPACEKEY as DRAFTSP17_, contentent0_.DRAFTTYPE as DRAFTTYPE, contentent0_.DRAFTPAGEVERSION as DRAFTPA19_, contentent0_.PAGEID as PAGEID, contentent0_.PARENTCOMMENTID as PARENTC21_, contentent0_.USERNAME as USERNAME from CONTENT contentent0_ where (contentent0_.VERSION in(select max(contentent1_.VERSION) from CONTENT contentent1_ where (contentent1_.PREVVER=131080 )or(contentent1_.CONTENTID=131080 ) group by contentent1_.LASTMODIFIER))and((contentent0_.PREVVER=131080 )or(contentent0_.CONTENTID=131080 )) order by contentent0_.VERSION asc;
{code}

After deleting the version information, rebuilding the indexes takes a much shorter amount of time (less than 30 seconds versus more than a half hour).  Customers have reported indexing times over six hours related to this problem.

XML backups from the instance also fail with heap space warnings, even though the instance has a total of two pages and has 1.5 Gb of heap.

Attached is an SQL dump from a sample instance of Confluence 3.1.2 that can be used to reproduce the problem.  The sample data was created using the remote API to update two pages a few thousand times.  One page simply contains a number (the pass number of the update script).  The other page has more data.



h4. Workaround
*Always backup your data before performing any modifications to the database.*
To remove the version data for the problem pages:

1- Make sure no queries are stuck reading from the content table, as this would prevent you from adding or removing any information from that table. You can either:
* Stop Confluence and make sure the process is no longer running.
* Kill any existing queries reading from the content table using a tool like the mysqladmin command-line utility.

2- Run a query like the following to find pages with over 1000 versions:
{code}select PREVVER from CONTENT group by PREVVER having count(PREVVER) > 1000;{code}

Review the pages by entering the ID returned in the query into a URL like BASE_URL/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=PREVVER as in:
http://wiki.mycompany.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=PREVVER
http://wiki.mycompany.com/confluence/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=PREVVER
If the pages are outdated or unneeded, you can simply delete them from within the web interface.
If the pages are still needed, you can remove previous versions using the previous version data from the query above. Simply replace PREVVER in the following queries with the value for the page, and run the queries in the order shown:
{code}delete from bodycontent where contentid in (select contentid from content where prevver='PREVVER');
{code}
{code}delete from content where prevver='PREVVER';{code}
3- Rebuild your indexes by [rebuilding the content index from scratch|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Rebuild+the+Content+Indices+from+Scratch].
fields.summary: Large number of revisions for a single page cause performance problems when using MySQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19699].
  {panel}

We've seen issues in support with bundled plugins that get upgraded. These plugins are not tested against old versions (presumably). A bundled plugin is an implementation detail - it's essentially part of the product, not a feature that needs upgrading separately.

Some examples:
- Confluence USage Tracking version 0.13 disables itself on Version 3.2 (0.12 is bundled)
- The Mail Page Plugin from 3.1.1 disables itself after upgrade

We should prevent bundled plugins from being upgraded.
fields.summary: Prevent bundled plugins from being upgraded

at com.atlassian.renderer.wysiwyg.converter.ListConverter.convertNode(ListConverter.java:32)
at com.atlassian.renderer.wysiwyg.converter.DefaultWysiwygConverter.convertNode(DefaultWysiwygConverter.java:270)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19684].
  {panel}

Our confluence site currently hosts pages which are written in german, english and occassionaly spanish or russian. Everybody has its own take on how to put multiple languages on one page. Unfortunately there is no markup to specify a language for a content area. Also page titles would have to either respect this markup or use additional metadata.

A macro in the style of {lang:de-DE} which displays content based on the users or default site language would probably be easy to implement. 

Textile however provides a nice way to create spans which can be supplied with a language attribute. The introduction of spans in wiki syntax would also provide powerful formatting possibilities without having to resort to HTML-like syntax like some plugins do. 
Here is how spans in german and english would look like:
%[de-DE]Ein Paragraph in Deutsch%
%[en-EN]A paragraph in english%
You can try the full textile notation at http://textism.com/tools/textile/index.php 

Another approach would be to specify a language for the whole page. In practise this would be very impractical because often only parts of the page need to be translated, for example a summary. Other content like a spare parts list and the page structure are language neutral.
fields.summary: content markup for languages

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce
# Go to {{Dashboard > Administration > Plugin Manager}}, click on *Confluence Usage Stats* plugin
# If it's enabled, disable it
# Click on *Enable plugin*
# Refresh the page, it should bring you to something like this:
[^4.Refresh_After_Enable.png]
If you _double_-clicked on *Enable plugin* in Step 3, you will get the same thing too.
And also notice that under the plugin name at the left side, it's written *Errors loading plugin* like this:
[^Errors_loading_plugin.png]
## Click on *Enable plugin*, you will get an error message like the following:
[^4.1Enable_After_Refresh.png]
## *Or* refresh the page again, you will get the same error message
# After getting the error as described in step 4.1 or 4.2, an *Uninstall plugin* option appears. AFAIK, bundled plugins should not have an *Uninstall plugin* option. If you click on *Uninstall plugin*, you will get a System Error page:
[^5.System_Error.png]

\\
h5. Workaround
* A restart of Confluence instance will make the plugin functional again.

\\
h5. Findings
|| Confluence Version || Plugin || Remarks ||
| 2.8, 2.9, 2.10, 3.0, 3.1, 3.2 | Bundled *Confluence Usage Stats* plugin | Reproducible |
| 3.1, 3.2 | Bundled *Advanced Macros* plugin | Reproducible |
| 3.2 | Bundled *Confluence HTML Macros* plugin | Reproducible |
| 3.2 | Bundled *WebDAV Plugin* plugin | Reproducible |

The link browser will throw up an error "Unterminated string constant" when searching for an attachments belonging to a page containing quotes (")

This are the steps to replicate the error
# Create page and name it as *Testing adding of "links"*
# Attach a file *empty.txt* (I created an empty text file) to the page
# Create a child page and name it as *Testing*
# Try to add the link in the page by searching *empty.txt*
# The empty.txt is shown on the Link Browser. However clicking on the link does not work.

For FF3, there is no error message shown. But for IE6, the javascript error above is displayed.
fields.summary: Cannot link to attachments from pages with title containing quotes

fields.description: The flying pdf export plugin (version 1.7 and earlier) creates the pdfs for export in a temporary directory on the form pdfexport-20100517-17May10-0917AM-1 this is locale dependent as Japanese and Russian locales will write the appropriate characters for the "AM". This means that either the file-system can not handle it (unlikely but a risk), and confluence will strip the multibyte characters from the url, leading to a HTTP-403. We should *not* have any language dependent parts in the directory names.
fields.summary: Flying PDF plugin uses locale dependent names when creating files

fields.description:
Support is experiencing many cases dealing with index performance & resource issues. modify the plugin to enable user to: - limit the size of the file can be indexed - limit the time ...(ie timeout) if indexing takes too long on a file - log index time

h4. Workaround

Download the [1.6.2|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/221?versionId=24952] version of the plugin which has this fix and [CONF-19779|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-19779] fix, backported. 

* Browse through your bundled plugins folder should be <confluence_isntall>\WEB-INF\classes\com\atlassian\confluence\setup\atlassian-bundled-plugins.zip

* Unzip the files under a known location, locate OfficeConnector-1.*.jar save a copy, and delete it.

* Download [OfficeConnector-1.6.2.jar|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/221?versionId=24952] and place inside this location.

* Zip this folder ( DO NOT ZIP THE FOLDER, ONLY THE FILES INSIDE IT, THE ZIP MUST NOT CONTAIN FOLDERS)

* Rename to atlassian-bundled-plugins.zip

Also for more knowledge please refer to [Removing Malfuntioning Plugins|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Removing+Malfunctioning+Plugins] this should do it.
fields.summary: OutOfMemoryError indexing Excel Documents
Twitter widget

fields.description:
Use case:

I am editing a Confluence page using the Rich Text Editor with Firefox on a Mac. I want to use the standard Mac keyboard shortcut to enable bold text, so I hit Command + B.

This launches Firefox's Bookmarks side bar. If I want to enable bold text I have to use the Windows shortcut, Control + B.

This applies to other shortcuts in the editor, like italics etc

We should adopt the behaviour of Gmail which recognises you are in the editor and overrides any browser shortcuts. Hence, when using Gmail on a Mac, pressing Command + B enables bold.
fields.summary: Mac friendly rich text editor shortcuts

fields.description:
If an intruder is able to pull a backup file from the system, sufficiently strong encryption will render it effectively useless to them.
Symmetric encryption isn't a viable solution because Confluence must be able to access the encryption (and thus decryption) key, which means an intruder with sufficient control of the instance can also acquire it. By contrast, public-key encryption allows the decryption key to be kept out of reach.
fields.summary: Public-key encryption of backups

fields.description:
When trying to move a page with attachments, or a page that has children which have attachments, I will get "Move failed. There was a problem contacting the server."

At first glance, this might sound similar to other bug reports about this issue, but the difference here is that I never lose any attachments or otherwise end up with missing data.  The pages that didn't move are still where they started, and have all of their attachments.

When hitting one of these pages that won't move, I've experimented with moving only one of its children that doesn't have attachments and that always works.

Here's the strange part.  I was able to move one page with a child that had 26 attachments to a new space.  All of the attachments made it with the page to the new space just fine.  However, the page itself had links to these attachments embedded in the page code (they were PDFs).  All of the links had "oldspace:" inserted in front of the links, so they were all broken.  I edited the page removing the "oldspace:" and the links worked once again.

I tried rebuilding the ancestor table, but that did not change anything.
fields.summary: Pages with attachments almost always fail to move to a different space
